title: fix(social): commit images to GitHub for stable Buffer URLs
author: ElliotEtag

gist.headline: Stabilizing the signal
gist.blurb: Our social bot now commits images directly to GitHub, ensuring Buffer always gets the picture.
gist.summary: Updated social media generation scripts to commit image files to the repository instead of using dynamic generation URLs, fixing Buffer fetch errors.
gist.impact: Internal social media automation is now more reliable.
gist.visual_concept: A robotic bee (the social bot) carefully placing a polaroid photo into a filing cabinet (GitHub) instead of just holding it up.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a robotic bee carefully filing a polaroid photo into a green filing cabinet. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting. Represents stabilizing data storage. Nostalgic but beautiful.

image.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a robot bee carefully placing a polaroid photo into a secure file folder. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Pixel text 'SAVED'. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
